page.title: 08MODERN ART GALLERY,EDINBURGH
page.content: In 1762 John Watson died and left Â£5000 to a charity to use as they thought best. In 1822 this amount had been expanded to Â£110,000 and was used to start a school with boarding facilities to house and educate the fatherless children of the professional classes. The school was in use up until 1981 at which time it became the{Scottish National Gallery} {of Modern Art.} The gallery has three floors with 22 galleries. It also has a library for studying art and the artists of the 20th century. The gallery also has a tea shop which sells small prints of the paintings and post-cards. Many of the larger sculptures and exhibits are displayed in the grounds outside. The grounds are very extensive,extending right down to the Water of Leith.
